Sadly those who beleive the longevity of the Tokugawa clan's control of 
Ja=
pan is due to any particular martial arts form are, with no doubt, 
wrong. =
It was from the beginning a solid understanding and practice of 
Confucian =
political beleifs and studies. This has been well documented 
and is withou=
t argument. Rather my change of subject conversation was 
how modern Japan =
has developed, no, rather profitted from 200 years of 
Tokugawa control. I =
beleive the beauty that is Japan would not be so if 
were not for the 200 y=
ears of isolation mandated by the Tokugawas. 
Starting with Ueyesu the Toku=
gawas ruled unlike any other leaders. Of 
course those who enjoy the battle=
 will say life was better under 
Hideyoshi or even Noubanaga. That exciting=
 timeframe was not the topic 
in the least. My thoughts were directed more =
to the enforcement of non 
militaristic training for all Tokugawa senior wa=
rriors such as the 
arts, his mircomanagement of all aspects of daily life =
from the only 
approved design and measurement of building houses to how a =
bucket of 
rice was to be sold and on to even what could and could not be s=
poken 
of in public.
